description: An NBA podcast featuring a rotating lineup of the best insiders, writers, and reporters from The Athletic. Monday thru Saturday. Monday: Basketball Buds with Zach Harper and Friends | Tuesday: Tampering with Sam Amick, Anthony Slater and Fred Katz | Wednesday: Hoops Adjacent with David Aldridge and Marcus Thompson | Thursday: Point of Contention with Zach Harper, Marcus Thompson and Special Guests | Friday: Nerder She Wrote with Dave DuFour, Seth Partnow, and Mo Dakhil | And the Saturday Slam & Jam with Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers. Plus, The NBA Daily Ding, a quick recap of the previous night's action.

items.content:
Slam and Jam
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers are joined by Sean Highkin of the Rose Garden Report to discuss the Blazers, their luck in the lottery, what they will do with Dame, and trade options for the 3rd overall pick
Then the guys are joined by James Edwards III of the Athletic to discuss the Pistons, them falling to 5th in the lottery, players that makes sense at 5, players the Pistons might trade the 5th pick for, and more. Then they boys play a fun edition of Andrew vs. the Beat.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Daily Ding: Warriors strike back | Knicks survive

items.content:
On this week's Hoops Adjacent, David Aldridge is joined by J.A. Adande and Vernon Maxwell to dive into what it is like competing in intense playoff series, the way role players can flip a series and how Maxwell would have handled the Jokic-Ishbia run-in in the Suns-Nuggets series.
*Disclaimer: there's a fair amount of cursing in this episode, so save this one for when the kids aren't listening*

items.content:
On episode 4 of Stargazing, host Jovan Buha brings on Zack Gonzales, a basketball trainer who works with several NBA players including Klay Thompson and Austin Reeves, as well as spent time on the Los Angeles Lakers staff working with LeBron James, Anthony Davis and Russell Westbrook. Zack breaks down how he became a trusted resource for NBA stars, the hours of hard work that goes into being a basketball trainer and how he literally slept in his car to get a big career break.

Then the boys are joined by Brad Rowland of Locked on Hawks to discuss the Hawks weird season, the Trae and Murray pairing, choosing between Capela and Okongwu, and more. Then the guys play a rousing rendition of Andrew vs. the Beat.

items.title: Deadline Decode

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA. Zion Williamson will miss more time after aggravating his injured hamstring. The Warriors have until Sunday night to make a decision on the Gary Payton II trade. The Celtics beat the Grizzlies thanks to 23 points from Derrick White. Kyrie Irving and Luka Doncić pair up for the first time against the Kings, but come up short thanks to 36 points from De'Aaron Fox.

items.title: Daily Ding: LeBron James breaks all-time scoring record

items.content:
Tampering
Sam Amick, Fred Katz, and Anthony Slater are joined by Mavericks beat writer Tim Cato to discuss Kyrie Irving being traded to the Mavs, how it came together, how Kyrie fits in with the team, and much more.
Then the guys are joined by Andy Bernstein, legendary NBA photographer to discuss LeBron James inching toward the NBA scoring record that will likely be broken this week. They discuss Andy's career of covering the NBA, including the game where Kareem Abdul-Jabbar passed Wilt Chamberlain.
The guys then break down what to expect at the trade deadline this Thursday.

items.title: It's Good to be the Kings

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA. The Boston Celtics extend their winning streak to 9 games with a victory over the Toronto Raptors. The Sixers pick up a win in Sacramento to close out a 5-0 roadtrip. The Warriors fumble a 17 point lead and Kyrie Irving scores 38 points as the Nets steal a victory in the Bay. The Lakers come back from a 25 point deficit to embarrass the Portland Trail Blazers.

items.title: Separation from the Pack

items.content:
Mo Dakhil and Dave DuFour recap the night in the NBA. The Boston Celtics won an overtime thriller in their NBA Finals rematch against the Golden State Warriors. Joel Embiid records his 7th straight 30+ point game en route to a fourth consecutive Philadelphia victory. The Bulls and Pistons matched up in Paris. The Minnesota Timberwolves come from behind to steal a win against the Raptors.

Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA. The Brooklyn Nets won their 18th game out of their last 20 with a victory over the Miami Heat, but Kevin Durant left with a knee injury. The Memphis Grizzlies defeated the Utah Jazz thanks to 5 blocks and 3 steals from DPOY candidate Jaren Jackson Jr. The Indiana Pacers pick up 2 victories over the weekend against Portland and Charlotte.

Mo Dakhil and Dave DuFour recap the night in the NBA. The Bucks and Raptors had a brick throwing contest, which was eventually, mercifully, finished in overtime with a Bucks win. An Evan Mobley jumper with 4 seconds remaining completed Cleveland's comeback victory over the Phoenix Suns. The Pacers pushed the Embiid-less 76ers to overtime only to see Deanthony Melton's late 3 pointer seal their loss.

Tampering Podcast

Sam Amick and Anthony Slater discuss the red-hot Nuggets who have risen to the top of the Western Conference. What is the Nugget's ceiling? Then they bounce to Minnesota where the Timberwolves might be the most disappointing team in the NBA. How did they get here, and is there a way out?

Then at the 28:00 mark Alex Schiffer of the Athletic joins the boys to discuss the Nets, their rise from the ashes, and how they are getting the job done.

Zion Williamson's career-high 43 points, including 14 in the final 3 minutes, leads New Orleans Pelicans to victory over Minnesota Timberwolves. DeMar DeRozan's impressive 42-point performance helps Chicago Bulls defeat Milwaukee Bucks, who suffer their fourth consecutive loss. Brooklyn Nets continue their winning streak with a 10th straight victory over Atlanta Hawks.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Young Ones
Jared Weiss, Jovan Buha, Law Murray, Will Guillory and Tim Cato discuss Luka Doncic's insane night and defining greatness in the NBA from the eyes of beat writers who have covered LeBron, Kawhi, Tatum, Zion, Paul George, and Luka himself.
Then Shams Charania joins Andrew Schlecht to discuss Myles Turner extension talks, Sabonis' injury, and Tyrese Maxey's return.
Then in Part 2 of Young ones, the guys discuss the Pelicans rise.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Mark Schindler and Dave DuFour recap the action from Boxing Day. The Nets extend their winning streak to 9 games with a road victory in Cleveland. The Clippers erased a late double-digit lead to force overtime before eventually subduing the scrappy young Pistons. A late Tyler Herro jumper helps the Heat hold off the Timberwolves in spite of 29 points from Anthony Edwards.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Welcome to the Athletic NBA Show Christmas Special!
Join us as we bounce around the Athletic NBA Show for Seasons Greetings!
Zach Harper takes us through the Christmas Day slate
David Aldridge and Marcus Thompson discuss Christmas Past
The Point of Contention Crew including Zach Harper, Jay King and Marcus Thompson give out gifts
Dave DuFour, Seth Partnow, and Mo Dakhil play a fun game of Naughty or Nerder
Andrew Schlecht, Alex Speers and JE Skeets play Christmas Day Trivia
and last, but not least, Mike Smeltz sends us off with a wonder poem about Ballmas.
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all our listeners! We are thankful for you!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Katie Heindl (BasketballFeelings.com) joins Seth Partnow, Mo Dakhil, and Dave DuFour to kick off trade season in the NBA. Should Toronto move on from Fred VanVleet?

The Splash Brothers combined for 66 points for the Warriors to hand the Celtics a big loss in their NBA Finals rematch. AJ Griffin hit an improbably buzzer beater in overtime to lift the Atlanta Hawks over the Chicago Bulls.

Mo Dakhil and Dave DuFour recap an absolutely wild finish between the Denver Nuggets and Portland Trailblazers. Jamal Murray's last second setback three pointer seals the deal for Denver 121 to 120. The Spurs snap an 11 game losing streak thanks to 32 points from Keldon Johnson. Bam Adebayo leads the Miami Heat to a home victory over the Clippers.

items.title: Heat of the Moment

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA. The Milwaukee Bucks move to a franchise best 9 and 0 to start the season after picking up back to back wins over Minnesota and Oklahoma City. The Suns and Blazers trade off wins in their Phoenix back to back. Phoenix trades off starters with Deandre Ayton returning to the lineup as Cam Johnson is sidelined. The surprising Utah Jazz move to 8 and 3 after a pair of wins over the Lakers and the Clippers.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

  1. Who will win Most Improved Player?

items.title: Free Agency Primer: Part 2

items.content:
The basketball Buds hosted by Zach Harper. With Travonne Edwards, Jay King, Mo Dakhil and James Edwards III.
Rundown: 
— Kyrie situation. Logan Murdock reports KD frustrated Nets didn’t try to get to know Kyrie situation better. 
— Draymond said warriors will still beat Lakers if Kyrie joins them 
— Beal reportedly staying with Wiz, LaVine reportedly staying with Bulls 
— Deandre Ayton gone from Phoenix but to whomst?

The Nerdown:
Pump the brakes .This is a close series.
Coaching advantage for Boston '
Success and failure, for both teams!
Boston needed to step up on Steph
Boston doesn’t care about Draymond
Third Quarter Warriors
Jaylen Brown & Jayson Tatum playmaking
Horford and White / hot shooting
Adjustments for Game 2
Warriors need to play/coach better
Play bigger / more Tatum post touches
Curry work off ball
Warriors attack basket

items.title: Warriors x Celtics NBA Finals Run-Up

items.content:
Sam Amick, Fred Katz and Anthony Slater discuss 5 questions heading into the NBA Finals 
1. Key matchup
2. Which role player needs to step up for Boston to win? Same with GSW?
3. Stat to watch
4. Which defense is more dominant (with health being considered too)?
5. LEGACY: Yeah, we're doing it. If Steph/Klay/Draymond win it, what does that mean? Ditto for the Tatum/Brown/Smart trio that would put Boston ahead of the Lakers with an 18th trophy.

items.title: Not According to Plan: Suns and Bucks Out, Celtics, Mavs In

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap an elimination filled weekend in the NBA playoffs. The Dallas Mavericks stun the Suns in a blowout game 7 to advance to the Western Conference Finals. The Golden State Warriors finished off the Memphis Grizzlies 4 games to 2. The Boston Celtics pick up back to back elimination game victories to end the Milwaukee Bucks' quest for a second consecutive championship.

items.title: Daily 🛎️ Ding: Mavs eclipse Suns, Warriors handle Grizz, Embiid back!, Giannis here!

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and special co-host Will Guillory are joined by Mark Schindler to discuss topics from around the NBA and if they sink or float:

Giannis is the best player left in the Playoffs

The Grizzlies are lucky to be tied 1-1

Miami is the most underrated team left in the Playoffs

Phoenix is the heavy favorite to win it all

This is the last time we will see this version of the Mavs (Luka, Dinwiddie, Brunson)

The Suns targeting Luka exposes his lack of elite conditioning 

We are entering a new chapter of James Harden’s career

Philly won’t get a game against Miami

The Celtics figured something out with Grant Williams and Horford on Giannis


Then the guys are joined by Keith Parish to discuss the Memphis Grizzlies and their series with the Golden State Warriors.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Giannis is the best player left in the Playoffs

The Grizzlies are lucky to be tied 1-1

Miami is the most underrated team left in the Playoffs

Phoenix is the heavy favorite to win it all

This is the last time we will see this version of the Mavs (Luka, Dinwiddie, Brunson)

The Suns targeting Luka exposes his lack of elite conditioning 

We are entering a new chapter of James Harden’s career

Philly won’t get a game against Miami

The Celtics figured something out with Grant Williams and Horford on Giannis

items.content:
Nerder, She Wrote with Dave DuFour, Seth Partnow and Mo Dakhil
Rundown
Refereeing in the playoffs. Too many flagrant fouls.
Golden State/Memphis
Both teams should feel lucky to be 1-1 in the series
Guarding Ja
Who starts for Gary Payton?
Klay expectations / Draymond a little sloppy
Desmond Bane injury
Mavs/Suns
Suns shooting is scorching hot
Luka was hunted on defense
Too much usage on offense?
Not a Brunson series
Dallas’ offense can’t target guys
Devin Booker defends
James Jones has been great as GM
Miami/Philly
Bam has been ridiculous
He’s supposed to be
Philly is toast without Embiid
Even if Embiid comes back
What is up with Harden?
Celtics/Bucks

Bucks defense struggling to run Boston off the 3 ball
Bucks offense
Can’t generate 3s
Middleton / Smart

items.title: Daily Ding: Celtics knuck Bucks to even series, Ja carries Grizzlies over troubled Warriors

items.content:
Sam Amick, Fred Katz and Anthony Slater discuss the 2nd round of the playoffs including:

Is Miami/Philly due to be a quick series (and related topics)?

Is there something wrong with James Harden or is this what he is now? And if so, what does that mean for Philadelphia?

Are the Suns the favorites after that coast-to-coast performance against Dallas?

How should we be evaluating these 40-point playoff performances in Luka during losses?

How does Boston respond to Giannis' Game 1 domination?

Should the Grizzlies be worried that they had Game 1 at home with a full half of no Draymond Green, a mundane Steph performance and a bad shooting night from Klay, and they still lost?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA playoffs. On Friday, the Grizzlies punched their ticket to the second round by winning their series against the Wolves 4 games to 2. The second round started off with a Bango as the Bucks trucked the Celtics. In spite of Draymond Green's second quarter ejection, the Golden State Warriors manage to steal home court from the Memphis Grizzlies in game one of their second round series.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Pelican's Positive Exit with Antonio Daniels + Bucks Deep Dive

items.content:
Rundown:
Memphis and Minnesota is chaos
Favorite things: Rudy Gobert bee sting "There’s a few things. It’s good for the environment, it’s good for the landscape, the flowers, the fruits. And I love honey, so I always wanted to have my own. It’s great. Sometimes there’s some casualties."
Draymond passing the ball off guys heads
Mutual respect in the playoffs Dallas/Phoenix similarities and differences winning without their stars
Matchups
Players who have changed our perspectives
Tatum is a dude
Jalen Brunson broke Utah’s defense
Herb Jones may have breakout potential
Brandon Ingram as a number 1 option
Can you trust D’Angelo Russell?
Donovan Mitchell was bad Steph back?
Jaren Jackson is a foul machine
KAT complains too much
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Basketball Buds. Zach Harper, Jay King, Mo Dakhil and Tray Edwards recap the action packed first weekend of the NBA Playoffs.
Rundown:
Nets vs Celtics, the crazy finish and Kyrie the Villain. Did the Celtics save their season?
Timberwolves shock the Grizzlies, Memphis in trouble? Does anyone think the Wolves can pull out series?
Mavs vs Jazz, no Doncic no problem for Utah.
Bucks vs Bulls, an ugly, boring game got interesting late. DeMar not good.
Nuggets vs Warriors. Dubs drain Jokic. Where is Murray?
Raptors vs 76ers. Philly playing fast.
Suns vs Pelicans | Hawks vs Heat
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers preview the 4 playoff series in the East starting with the Heat and Hawks then followed by the Bucks and Bulls. 

Then oh boy... we get to the juicy matchups, and with those juicy matchups, we have some juicy guests. 

Tas Melas of No Dunks joins to talk Raptors, and Trill Bro Dude of the You Know Ball podcast joins to talk 76ers. 

Then for the Celtics Nets series, we are joined by Brian Eagan of the Glue Guys and Sam Jam Packard of Anything is Poddable to help us break down those series.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Eastern Conference Playoff Preview

items.content:
Nerder, She Wrote with Dave DuFour, Seth Partnow and Mo Dakhil. With Ben Thompson ~ Thinking Basketball.

Memphis/Minnesota What’s up with Towns? Jaren is the X Factor Grizzlies weaknesses on the perimeter Who guards Ja? Pat Bev vs Dillon Brooks 27 ish Warriors / Is Steph healthy? Are the Warriors more talented than the Nuggets? Can the Nuggets win? After Looney, who? Can the Mavs win without Luka? Good matchup for Dinwiddie and Brunson. How does Utah counter if they lose game 1 without Luka?. Donovan Mitchell’s struggles. Much more.

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention James Edwards III and Jay King debate! Hosted by Marcus Thompson.
Take 1: Is KD right to not want to stoke the Celtics? 
Take 2: How much is Phoenix hoping Luka doesn’t get healthy and the Mavericks don’t advance? 
Take 3: Do the Lakers need a motivator, a tactician, someone who can
help decide on personnel? And who fits that bill? 
Take 4: Grizz v Wolves Petty Wars
Take 5: Lack of Vax Raptor'cussions

Last week of the season no better time for a end of season Mailbag. Dave, Seth and Mo answer listener questions.
Rundown:
NCAA tournament and college basketball thoughts
Young teams in the NBA playing well
Detroit vs New York best future?
Best rookies + Cade’s development during the season
British food or basketball?
Who can beat the Suns?
Memphis with and without Ja
Can the Clippers make the conference finals? Is Paul George underrated?
Upset alert for Miami and Philly!
Breakout players in the playoffs?
Can Utah make a run?
Why are the Lakers? (Mo rant!)

items.content:
The Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Mo Dakhil and Tray Edwards. The Lakers are just about finished, what happens next? Also, the Pelicans success behind CJ McCollum has New Orleans looking bright in the playoffs perhaps vs the Spurs. Timberwolves vs Clippers playin? Looking forward in the West, how big a concern is Ja Morant's knee issue? The terrible Jazz. The very surprising Mavs. In the East, are the Nets as good as we think they are? Much more.

items.title: Rookie of the Year Race + Raptors Rise

items.content:
Mark Schindler and Dave DuFour recap an eventful night in the NBA. The Hornets take advantage of a huge Mason Plumlee game (yes, that Mason Plumlee) to hold off the Pelicans 106-103. LeBron James records a 38 point triple double in Cleveland to lift the Lakers over the Cavaliers. The Sixers beat the East-leading Heat without Joel Embiid AND James Harden. The Nets hammer the Jazz thanks to 37 from Kevin Durant. Christian Wood goes 8 of 9 from 3 en route to 39 points to lead the Rockets to a 23 point comeback win over the Wizards. The Mavericks gut out a rough shooting game from Luka Doncić to beat the Timberwolves 110-108.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

The Mavericks gut out a rough shooting game from Luka Doncić to beat the Timberwolves 110-108.

Mark Schindler and Dave DuFour recap the night in the NBA. Nikola Jokić leads the Nuggets over Joel Embiid and the Sixers 114-110. Draymond Green's return sparks 47 points for Steph Curry in a Warriors win over the Wizards. Evan Mobley scores a career high 30 points to lead the Cavaliers to an overtime victory versus the Clippers. Karl Anthony Towns scores 60 as the Wolves down the Spurs 149-139. Giannis Antetokounmpo's 30 points lifts the Bucks over the Jazz in Utah.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap an action packed weekend. Kevin Durant hangs 53 on the Knicks to lead the Nets to a 110-107 victory. Luka Dončić finds Spencer Dinwiddie for the game winning three to lift the Mavericks over the Celtics 95-92. Klay Thompson scores 38 and Jordan Poole scores 30 as the Warriors dominate the Bucks. Alex Caruso returns for the Bulls as they defeat the Cavaliers 101-91.

Plus a real behind the scenes listen of who the architects of Heat Culture really are and how they do it.

Ja Morant returns after injury, but can't top D'Angelo Russell's huge fourth quarter as the Timberwolves defeat the Grizzlies. DeMar DeRozan scores 37 to lead the Bulls over the Hawks, including a three point play to take the lead.

items.content:
Former GM for the Nets and 76ers Billy King stops by to chat with David and Marcus about the Trade Deadline. What a week it is, and already with big trades between the Pacers and Kings and the Blazers and Pelicans. Also the differences between trades being made today versus back in the day. Deadline deals afoot, dealing with the pressures of ownership, management and fans, stats and info, "make sure you get the physical!" ....the clock is ticking. Tick Tock Tick Tock.

Finally we end the show with a discussion on Bradley Beal and his upcoming surgery.

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap the weekend in the NBA. Fred VanVleet's two three pointers in the third overtime period lift the Toronto Raptors over the Miami Heat 124-120 in Triple OT!!! The Warriors outlast Kyrie Irving and the Harden - less Nets 110-106 thanks to an All Star performance from Andrew Wiggins. Cade Cunningham records a triple double in the second half to lead the Detroit Pistons over the Cleveland Cavaliers 115-105.

And finally, Howard weighs in on the historic Lakers mess, wasting LeBron and who's responsible.

Food is fuel - and for high level athletes like NBA players, what they eat effects how they play. Christian Bowman is a personal chef who has worked closely with some of the biggest stars in the NBA including Jimmy Butler, Kyrie Irving and Russell Westbrook. Christian joins Jovan Buha to discuss his path to becoming a personal chef, the ins and outs of his unique career, and the role he plays in NBA superstars' lives.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this week's Nerder, She Wrote with Jared Weiss, Mo Dakhil and Seth Partnow.
RUNDOWN
-Lakers terrible roster, Frank Vogel still coaching somehow, Russ fit, Pelinka and Rambis screwing this team up
-Celtics Tatum and Brown playmaking not enough, team needs more playmaking and shooters, using Rob Williams better
-Hawks: What’s wrong with team, need playmaker with trae, trae gunning it and john collins unhappy, fire Nate McMillan, bring back Lloyd Pierce for fun
-Nuggets/Clips game: Jokic needs to be superhuman for Nuggets to win, Bones Hyland shoutout for being a legend, Paul George UCL injury and Clippers developing without stars
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Rich Fresh is a celebrity designer and tailor at the forefront of something NBA players care deeply about - fashion. Rich’s business evolved during the pandemic, creating the Henry Mask, that took off after LeBron James wore on. Rich joins Stargazing to talk about his journey from being homeless to dressing some of the biggest names in entertainment and sports, including Justin Bieber, The Weeknd and Dwyane Wade. 
Find this episode and all episodes of Stargazing right here on The Athletic's YouTube Channel
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Jared Weiss and Will Guillory recap Wednesday night's big games. The Brooklyn Nets defeat the Indiana Pacers 129-121 in Kyrie Irving's season debut. A Jaylen Brown blown layup helps the San Antonio Spurs hold off the Boston Celtics 99-97 in Boston. The Utah Jazz defeat the Denver Nuggets 115-109 in spite of a monstrous game by Nikola Jokić in the absence of Rudy Gobert.

The Utah Jazz defeat the Denver Nuggets 115-109 in spite of a monstrous game by Nikola Jokić in the absence of Rudy Gobert.

The Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Jay King, Tray Edwards and Mo Dakhil celebrate the New Year {2022} reminiscing the weekend's two buzzer-beaters from the Bulls' DeMar DeRozan. New year, new Bulls??? and how the pieces fit together. From good to worse, the Lakers, Center LeBron's massive week, but for naught. The Lakers are searching for something...the play-in tournament? Then, some way too early MVP talk! DeMar in the lead? Ahead of Steph and KD? Finally, drama in H-Town between Coach Stephen Silas, Assistant John Lucas, Christian Wood and more!

Giannis Antetokounmpo spurred the Bucks to a late game comeback victory over the Celtics. The shorthanded Nets, led by James Harden and Patty Mills, hold off a spirited comeback by LeBron James as Brooklyn hands the Lakers their fifth straight loss.

items.content:
Welcome to the first episode of our new limited series - Stargazing, hosted by Jovan Buha from The Athletic. Stargazing is a show about the figures and influencers the define different areas of NBA subculture: style, fitness, barbers, nightlife, entertainment, social media, gaming and more. In the first episode of Stargazing - Vince the Barber joins host Jovan Buha to discuss his rise to the top of the barber game. The motivations behind moving from Toronto to Los Angeles, the big advice Kobe Bryant gave Vince along the way, and tells behind the scene stories from cutting Chadwick Boseman, Devin Booker and more.
Check out Vince's interview with Jovan right here on YouTube
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

The Warriors win over the Pacers in the final seconds, but Steph Curry remains 1 three pointer behind Ray Allen on the All Time Three Pointers Made list. The Cavaliers continue their impressive start to the season with another victory, this time over the shorthanded Miami Heat.

items.content:
Keith Parish and Dave DuFour recap an eventful weekend in the NBA. The Phoenix Suns won their 16th consecutive game, beating the Brooklyn Nets 113-107 on the second night of a back-to-back on Saturday. The Golden State Warriors extend their current winning streak to 7 games after handling the Blazers and the Clippers respectively over the weekend.

items.content:
Surprise! Happy Thanksgiving! It's Nerder time. We don't have time to argue!? ... leave that to your crazy uncle, aunty or whatever (it me) ~ Point of Contention will be back next week. Alas. In this week's edition of Nerder She Wrote, the Stooges (Dave,Seth and Mo) take a look at Tyrese Maxey's growth. Also, Kristaps Porzingis' health. Latvia/Estonia league shooting stats and the NBA ball change. Is playing faster always better? And....the Suns are a wins factory! Gobble Gobble Good Bad Ugly.

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Marcus Thompson and Jay King debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: While the weather called for overcast skies with a slight northerly wind, it RAINED hard in Brooklyn Tuesday night.
Take 2: We are now roughly a month into the season, teams have played about 14-15 games thus far, and looking across the league there are some troubling signs. So I ask, is it time to sound the alarm for these teams?
Take 3: Worried in the West? There’s certainly plenty of Panic to go around so let’s take a look at the Western Conference. (Jerry Seinfeld voice) What’s the deal with Portland?
Take 4: LeHuman James. Nothing heals a wound better than a Prime Time game!
Take 5: Speaking of guys that won a championship in a small town then bolted, news that Giannis might have his eyes set on (singing)..leaving on an airplane. Don’t know when Ill be back again, oh babe I hate to go!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

How times have changed. The Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Trey Edwards, Marcus Thompson and Mo Dakhil. This week the fellas take a look at two potential scandals in the NBA. One in Phoenix and the other in Portland. What is happening? Why is it happening now? Then some real basketball. Are the Warriors serious contenders? What about their defense? Also, guess who has the best offense in the league? Also, the Lakers without LeBron? Pretty, pretty, pretty, pretty ...terrible.

The Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Jay King, Travonne Edwards and Mo Dakhil. A vague report about Suns owner Robert Sarver has the guys wondering what's in store for the Suns and Chris Paul. Then, the cumbersome rollout of the NBA's Top 75 players and what they need to fix next time around. Then, Daryl Morey and Joel Embiid speak, again, on the Ben Simmons situation which now has a mental health component to it, what's next? Much more. As always, much much more.

The Golden State Warriors defeated the Los Angeles Lakers 121-114 behind Steph Curry's triple-double.

items.content:
POINT OF CONTENTION
DATE: 8/31/21
HOST: ZACH 
CO-HOST: JAMES | JAY


INTRO
Welcome to Point of Contention. Five Subjects Five Minutes. Five Points of Contention. 
Im Zach, Jade Hoye is producing.
Coming up on the show...Will Daryl trade 25? Confounding Cavs! Lillards Lips are Sealed? The Ancient Lakers and Free Agency Winners and Losers. 
In this corner, Flynt Michigan native, Pistons expert, Clippers fan, and future author of the book “Bad Boy: How Stan Van was not the Man”
It’s James Edwards III.
James, the new Kanye? Classic or Flaccid?
And in this corner…from the hard streets of Springfield Mass, Celtics beat reporter, and future author of the book From the Mid Ainge: The rise and fall of Danny Ainge … Jay ‘The Kid’ King
Jay, is Damian Lillard the greatest NBA rapper of all time?
(Banter)
SEG 1
Jade start the Clock! A matter of when not if!
***From The Athletic’s Shams Charania dateline August 30***
Since July the 76ers has conducted “expansive” discussions with several teams, including Minnesota and Toronto, but neither a Timberwolves package nor the Raptors’ proposals have appealed to the 76ers as of yet. 
Rival executives believe it’s only a matter of when — not if — the All-Defensive team stalwart is moved. 
For now, all signs continue to point to 25’s career in Philadelphia coming to an end.
(BREAKING NEWS) 
Hold on we got some breaking news happening right now. 
From Keith Pompey 25 now says he no longer wants to be with the 76ers! 
Whoaaaaaaa! 
From the Philadelphia Inquirer
Ben Simmons let it be known that he wants out. In a meeting with the 76ers last week in Los Angeles, Simmons told team co-managing partner Josh Harris, president of basketball operations Daryl Morey, general manager Elton Brand and coach Doc Rivers that he no longer wants to remain a Sixer, according to multiple sources. Sources said the three-time All-Star also does not intend to report to training camp.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Basketball Buds. Zach Harper, Jay King and Tray Edwards [insert: science music] analyze / dissect how Russell Westbrook will fit in with the Lakers and LeBron James. Space? Who needs Space? Then, the race to get Kyle Lowry, teams will. be a'scrambling....AND will DeMar DeRozan take LESS to play for MORE? And finally, our new BUDS game show "Match or Dispatch!" Lonzo Ball! Lauri Markkanen! John Collins! Who?? goes where? Who cares! It's TIME to rearrange the deck chairs on the Titanic! Oh, And much much more!

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers are joined by Matt Pennie to discuss the NBA Draft and hand out the following awards:


Favorite Fit Award

This award goes to our favorite player/team fit in the draft.

Strangest Draft Award

This award goes to the team with the strangest draft.

Biggest Jump in League Pass Rankings Award

This award goes to the team who improved their watchability the most.

WHY ARE THEY LETTING THEM DO THIS??? Award

This award goes to the good team that everyone freaked out about when they drafted a good prospect

Miffed and Peeved Award

This award goes to the most miffed and peeved fanbase after the draft.

So…What are you going to do now? Award

This award goes to the team who left draft night with the most questions.

Darkhorse Rookie of the Year Award

This award goes to the prospect outside the top-4 that has the best chance to win Rookie of the Year.

Best Draft Award

This award goes to the team that we think had the best draft overall.


Then Matt hangs around to play "Andrew vs. The Beat" an NBA trivia game centered on "Draft Night Trades"
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Strangest Draft Award

This award goes to the team with the strangest draft.

Biggest Jump in League Pass Rankings Award

This award goes to the team who improved their watchability the most.

WHY ARE THEY LETTING THEM DO THIS??? Award

This award goes to the good team that everyone freaked out about when they drafted a good prospect

Miffed and Peeved Award

This award goes to the most miffed and peeved fanbase after the draft.

So…What are you going to do now? Award

This award goes to the team who left draft night with the most questions.

Darkhorse Rookie of the Year Award

This award goes to the prospect outside the top-4 that has the best chance to win Rookie of the Year.

Best Draft Award

This award goes to the team that we think had the best draft overall.


Then Matt hangs around to play "Andrew vs. The Beat" an NBA trivia game centered on "Draft Night Trades"

items.title: PERK ALERT! LIVE NBA DRAFT SHOW

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Marcus Thompson and Jay King debate! Hosted by Zach Harper -- Produced by Jade Hoye -- Written by All

Take 1: Tonight’s the nite! That’s right, it’s finally time for the 2021 NBA Draft tonight at 8pm ET. Who’s rising, who is falling? Will the Pistons hold fast and take the great Case Cunningham at #1?
Take 2: Team USA back on track? Hell Ya! Team USA got their Olympics back on track with a 120-66 blowout win over Iran? ..........Wait........Who writes this stuff Daryl?
Take 3: It’s Tampering SZN Baby! Free agency doesn't “officially” start until Aug. 2, but we already know from past years, negotiations are already well underway. If only the NBA treated Tampering as thoroughly and stringent as it does INSTANT JAVY REPLAY at the end of games!
Take 4: Play In....Play Out...Who Cares?? [I am] Here to Stay! The NBA's play-in tournament is back for at least one more season. Adam Silver says: "We'll show you poor teams how to win!" {add fart noise] -- (Fart Noise)
Take 5: New Rules! The NBA LOVES new rules that it never follows! Adam Silver says "But we wear nice suits! and know how to dap!" ..........ya cool!

xo

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Meadowlark Media's Amin Elhassan drops by prior to Game 6 of the NBA Finals to talk about the Suns/Bucks. The narrative of Giannis and how quickly it changed. How the Bucks remind DA of the Chris Webber Kings. Has the Suns/Bucks Finals been good for the NBA? Will Giannis' profile grow if they win the title and the conversation surrounding his rise. And finally, will Chris Paul be in Phoenix next year?

items.title: Suns Are Too Good, Monty vs Mike, Bucks Plan

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Marcus Thompson and Amin Elhassan debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: On Tuesday night the Chris Paul Suns took Game 1 of the 2021 NBA Finals 118-105, led by Paul who had 32 points and 8 assists, the first player with 30 points and 8 assists in a Finals debut since Michael Jordan in 1991.
Take 2: Meanwhile, the Bucks will have to regroup and see if they can rally for a Game 2 win. Going down 2-0 heading back home will certainly be a MOUNTAIN to CLIMB and the master of “sticking to your guns” head coach Mike Budenholzer will have to adjust. Adjust?
Take 3: The Dawn of a New Era?
Take 4: The Coaching Carousel! You spin me right round baby right round like a record baby!
Take 5: Kevin 'USA' Love’s Rehab Assignment
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Suns Destiny Revealed? Bud’s Bucks Adjust? Dawn of a' New Era, + Coaching Carousel and Team USA’s Kevin Love Experiment

items.content:
In this week's Hoops Adjacent, Warriors GM / President of Basketball Ops Bob Myers joins David and Marcus to talk about the state of the Warriors. Managing success, when success is the expectations. How to stay competitive with an aging, well paid roster. Also, the effects of Klay Thompson's injury. Steph's great success last season, and Draymond's influence. How KD's return from injury gives insight and confidence into Klay return next season, and how he has evolved over the years. Plus handling the press, pandemic work problems and the importance of talking to people in person. Advice for new Mavs GM Nico Harrison, the dark places this game takes people, and maintaining integrity. Finally the fellas get Bob's thought's on the 2021 NBA Finals.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers bring on the Old Take Gauntlet:
1)	The Atlanta Hawks’ 2020 offseason was a mistake.
2)	The Rockets were idiots to not take Ben Simmons in a deal for James Harden.
3)	You can never trust Paul George in the playoffs.
4) The Jrue Holiday trade is a massive win for the Bucks.
5)	Doc Rivers is a significant upgrade over Brett Brown.
6) The Sixers are the best evidence that tanking works.
7)	The Jazz are a nice team, but they can’t win the title

In Part 2 former Presidential candidate and current New York City Mayoral candidate Andrew Yang joins to discuss his Nets fandom, who he thinks will make the finals, what he would do as NBA commissioner, and then we play a rousing match of Andrew vs. Andrew in Knicks trivia. 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Welcome to The Athletic NBA Show

items.content:
The Basketball Buds. Zach Harper, Jay King, Dave DuFour and James Edwards III. Off the top, the Nuggets are in trouble, obviously. But what is going on with the Nuggets? The fellas try to decode some of the coaching decisions by Mike "Michael" Malone. What's happening with Aaron Gordon? Are the Nuggets missing PJ Dozier? What about the Suns, what will happen to them to derail destiny? 16 Game Deandre Ayton and the "inspired by God" Suns. And how Chris Paul's contract is miraculously becoming value! Meanwhile, just when you thought the Bucks were dead, a divine act from God injures Kyrie Irving. For Coach Bud it's do or die! PJ Tucker vs Kevin Durant, the Refs Reffing by ruining the rhythm of the game, what happened to Joe Harris?? (Duncan Robinson 2.0) and much more. Oh...and what about the Sixers Hawks and Clippers Jazz? So much more.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this week's Nerder, Dave DuFour, Seth Partnow and Mo Dakhil chat with The Ringer's J. Kyle Mann (@jkylemann) about the Bucks win over the Nets on Thursday night. "The worst played game of the playoffs." - Seth. Why are the Bucks not running plays? Why is Giannis playing so reluctantly? PJ Tucker's defense on Kevin Durant. Then a look at the Clippers/Jazz series. How will the Clippers solve the Rudy Gobert problem. Then 76ers/Hawks, Danny Green slump, dealing with Embiid and much more. Finally Suns/Nuggets, can Denver figure out Chris Paul? Time is running out with the backcourt situation.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Bucks/Nets Game 3 Decode + Solving Rudy Gobert + Defending Trae Young + Embiid & Chris Paul

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Ethan Strauss and Marcus Thompson debate! Hosted by Zach Harper. 
Take 1: Now looking at Round 2, the Nets and Bucks series has been all KD and Kyrie, with James Harden going down early in Game 1 with a hamstring injury. Giannis is getting destroyed and to boot, the NBA put the whammy on the Nets’ countdown clock mocking Giannis’ dragged-out free-throw routine! No Fun! 
Take 2: To Stotts or not to Stotts?
Take 3: George was heckled by fans with chants of “Playoff P and Overrated.” Jade play the tape!
Take 4: The Ben Simmons Syndrome
Take 5: LeBron went to Instagram to post a video from the movie Gladiator! 


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Basketball Buds, Tray Edwards, Jay King and James Edwards go through Game 1 between the Hawks and 76ers. Trae Young's emergence continues, 76ers rally falls short. Then the Clippers finally figure out the Mavs and Luka Doncic. Also the Harden-less Nets get ready for Game 2 vs the Bucks, can Milwaukee fix their offense? Damian Lillard endorses Jason Kidd, Blazers fans not having it, what to do? James offers a theory, and Tray adds perspective. Also what to do about Dame's defense? Finally WCF predictions.

With the second round of the playoffs looming, the Nerder crew, Dave, Seth, and Mo take some time to catch up. Seth and Mo discuss their experiences after playoff losses. items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Ethan Strauss and Marcus Thompson debate. Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: Oh boy the drama that is unfolding out west between the Lakers and Suns, that is about to put a serious crimp in LeBron’s Space Jam 2 debut next month.
Take 2: Danny Ainge has been at the helm for 18 years with his greatest achievement being the 2008 NBA title with Kevin Garnett, Ray Allen and Paul Pierce. Since then Ainge accumulated a ton of young talent, draft picks and was notoriously always on the brink of making that big trade. But Ainge could not turn the corner, or even close for that matter.
Take 3: The legend of Damian Lillard, yet again, grew on Tuesday night as he orchestrated a game for the ages, scoring 55 points and an NBA playoff-record 12 3-pointers as the Trail Blazers lost to the Nuggets. Lost?
Take 4: The NBA issued an 11-point memo which states clearly, among other things, that alcoholic beverages will still be permitted but encourages fans to tell on guests for “inappropriate behavior” to the nearest usher, security guard, or guest services staff member.
Take 5: Fellas, it’s been too long without some Awards talk, and even though there is not technically an award for Playoff MVP, we’re doing it anyway. Who you got?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht hosts in place of Sam Amick today with Fred Katz, Anthony Slater and special guest Mike Smeltz. They discuss these 8 topics around the NBA Playoffs:
1. Have we learned anything about the Nets in their first round series? (With Mike Smeltz)
2. Who has the brighter future, Hawks or Grizzlies?
3.Will the Chris Paul injury or the Anthony Davis injury matter more in their 1st round series.
4. The Clippers have flipped the momentum on the Mavs, do we trust them to keep it?
5. What’s next for the Heat?
6.Nuggets or Blazers?
7. What more can the NBA do to stop the wild fan behavior? (Popcorn, spit, water bottle)
8. The Bucks currently have the 3rd best odds to win the title (+550) according to BetMGM, behind the Net (+200), and the Lakers (+450)... do we think that’s the right place for them?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Lakers in Trouble? Psyche!!, Luka Magic, Don Mitchell Upset! + Ref Disaster + Another Tournament?

items.content:
NBA's / TNT's Steve 'Smitty' Smith drops by to talk with David and Marcus, reminiscing about his signature move, paradigm shifts in the NBA and changing the mind of a nation. Runnin' with Magic and Gervin. "Giving back is part of our heritage," said DA. Then talking about the poised Atlanta Hawks and Trae Young's Game 1 performance against the Knicks. Small ball vs Bigs. Lakers in trouble? Clippers gonna wake up? "Luka is not scared of anybody." Donovan Mitchell's time and rhythm. How will the Nets do without a BIG? Jrue Holiday has changed the Bucks. Finally...get your time machine out...what team needs a "Smitty right now? And James Wiseman on the trading block confusion. What did Bob Myers say?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Suns Burning the Lakers Dynasty Hopes? Grizzlies starting something special?

items.content:
The Basketball Buds. Zach Harper, Jay King, Dave DuFour and Tray Edwards try to make sense of what happened in Game 1 of the Lakers vs Suns series...."WWE x NBA Collab?" says Tray. Then, is anyone excited about the Blazers win over the Nuggets in their opener? Also, Jay apologizes to Melo. Then, Luka dismantles Pat Bev then adds insult to injury and calls him "too small." Next up, KD disrespects the Celtics. Took over on both sides of the court. Kyrie takes the 3rd quarter. How can these guys be stopped? Too Big Tobias Harris and Doc Rivers a match made in heaven. Finally Knicks vs Hawks and the Heat hit an early road block on their way to beating the Bucks.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Eastern Conference Playoffs (Preview + Predicts)

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention Marcus Thompson and Jay King debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: Celtics get by the Wizards. Now, will the Nets win in 4 or 5 games? Or could this get interesting?
Take 2: Oh baby it’s on! The Miami Heat vs the Milwaukee Bucks. It’s Christmas, as far as we're concerned. THIS is the NBA Finals right here.
Take 3: For the first time in 9 years we will witness a Knicks playoff game as they take on Trae Young and the Atlanta Hawks.
Take 4: Kawhi vs Luka Round 2!
Take 5: Let’s take a look at the 3-6 matchup in the West. The Denver Nuggets led by imminent MVP Nicola Jokic vs the Dame Time’s Trail Blazers, one of the worst defensive teams in the league. 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Play-In Tournament (Conceptual) Breakdown

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention, Marcus Thompson and Ethan Strauss debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: Are we about to witness a play-in game for the ages? Los Angeles is still Golden State’s most likely opponent in a possible 7-8 matchup and that will be just what the TV ratings doctor ordered!
Take 2: Does the NBA teams need to put a stronger emphasis on bringing more veterans back into the league?
Take 3: Let’s just cut to the chase, when the Nets and 76ers finally play in the ECF who will win? (not answered)
Take 4: Finally the end of the regular season is upon us and it gives us one final shot at picking the Awards.
Take 5: Wizards guard Bradley Beal and his wife Kamiah put the full-court press on Kent Bazemore after he dismissed Beal’s Sunday night performance in which he dropped 50 points.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Part Two of The Athletic’s Origins story for Dell Technologies ‘Small Business Podference’ series. Writers, Marcus Thompson and Anthony Slater give their thoughts on that process as well.

items.title: Bonus Episode: The Athletic’s Small Business Story | Part 2 of 3

items.content:
On this week's episode of Hoops Adjacent David Aldridge and Marcus Thompson talk to NBA legend Jamal Crawford about the lack of veterans on NBA teams, spreadsheet basketball taking away the essence of basketball and Russell Westbrook being under-appreciated. Also what was the best team Jamal ever played for? Are score-first point-guards taking over the NBA? The abundance of talent in the NBA. items.content:
In the latest Point of Contention, Ethan Strauss and Marcus Thompson debate. Hosted by Zach Harper.

Take 1: LeBron James will be out at least the next two games for the Lakers and it could be longer! This according to ESPN. Following a 20-game absence James, the Star of Space Jam 2 out this summer, returned for two games with a high ankle sprain. But!
Take 2: Holy Shit the Suns are the best team in basketball?! What day is it? May 5th? That’s right fellas, the Phoenix Suns are now 47-18 riding a 5 game win streak into their game against the Hawks. 
Take 3: As predicted many times on this podcast channel, The Portland Trail Blazers are expected to move on from head coach Terry Stotts, after 9 years at the helm...this according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
Take 4: Are the Warriors Tanking? Just kidding, but man they must be regretting not picking LaMelo Ball cuz he’s back to ballin!
Take 5: More coaching hot-seat news, this just in. According to Sam Amick and Shams Charania Bucks head coach Mike “Why Change a Thing?” Budenholzer is gone “unless there’s a deep playoff run.”
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this week's edition of Hoops Adjacent, David Aldridge bids adieu to Wos Lambre as he heads over to The Ringer, and welcomes in Marcus Thompson as his new co-host. The two get to talking about the Warriors title chances in the future and if Brad Beal will be in the Bay next season. Then, this week's guest the great Eddie Johnson drops by to talk about the dangerous Suns as they speed their way into the playoffs. Chris Paul the ultimate leader mentoring Devin Booker's evolving greatness and playoff hopes. Mikal Bridges and the gentle giant Deandre Ayton. Also Eddie reflects back to his days playing for Phoenix and Cotton Fitzsimmons and the money that guys earn today, in a good way.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this week's Basketball Buds Dave DuFour, Jay King, James Edwards and Tray Edwards talk about the race for the playoffs in both the West and Eastern Conferences. LeBron is back, but say's he's never be the same player again. That's weird. Also Anthony Davis, still not right. Then, the guys are very confident about the Suns heading into the playoffs. Chris Paul and Devin Booker have made this a professional operation and very dangerous. Plus the Nuggets and the future MVP Nicola Jokic. In the East Philly, Brooklyn, Milwaukee are all in great shape. Don't sleep on the Heat! Can Jayson Tatum carry the Celtics? And finally the 4/5 seed battle.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht is joined by Fred Katz to discuss who the All NBA Guards should be. Is Luka a guard? Who are the locks? Is Chris Paul a lock? Kyrie or James Harden? Booker or Mitchell? Then they have a brief discussion on Georges Niang of the Utah Jazz. 

Andrew and Fred are then joined by Jason Jones of the Athletic to discuss the Sacramento Kings and their wild season. How can the improve from here? Will Buddy and Bagley be part of the team moving forward? and more. 

Then Jason sticks around for a trivia show, Fred vs. the Beat, where Fred tries his luck against the Kings beat writer in .... Kings Trivia! 

Then we spin the wheel of fandom to see who the next team is going to be. Listen in to find out!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention, Marcus Thompson and Ethan Strauss debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: In a time when fans are pretty much waiting for the playoffs to start the NBA has delivered! Russell Westbrook has delivered as well breaking the longstanding NBA record in the Wizards' 146-143 loss to the San Antonio Spurs: Wilt Chamberlain's record for triple-doubles in a single month, which has stood since 1968. Wilt had 11, Russ now has 12. 
Take 2: Cavaliers forward Kevin Love apologized for his on-court brain-fart Monday night, saying his behavior was out of character. "That wasn't me." he said. Wait. It wasn’t you? Well then who the hell was it? 
Take 3: This week, NBA legend Julius Irving aka Dr. J on 'Posted Up' with Chris Haynes did not include LeBron James, arguably one of the Top 3 players to play the game in his Top 2 All Time teams.
Take 4: After the game Steve Kerr said "They came out like it was a playoff game. We came out like it was an exhibition." Is now the time to tank?
Take 5: Is Julius Randle the Real MVP?

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

They also discuss the race for the Play In Tournament in the East and West including the hot play of the Warriors and Wizards, the Hornets, Mavs, Heat, Grizzlies and more.

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention, Marcus Thompson and Ethan Strauss debate! Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1 - Five years after he revolutionized the game of basketball, the baby faced assassin, Steph Curry is back-back, playing the best basketball of his career.
Take 2 - Fellas it is April 21 and the Phoenix Suns are now 41-6 sitting in second in the West beyond the Jazz
Take 3 - TV Ratings Coverup?
Take 4 - Wait a minute what’s this? Wow!!! I just found $500 bucks right here sitting on my desk. My lord, what a day.
Take 5 - LeBron, Giannis, LaMelo, A.D., K.D. Harden, Jamal Murray. What’s going on???

items.content:
Sam Amick, Fred Katz and Anthony Slater discuss hot take topics from around the NBA
1. Jokic should be the MVP
2. This is the best Steph has been
3. The Play In Tournament is a bad idea
4. Phoenix is a good regular season team, but won’t have another gear in the playoffs
5. Philly should get more consideration as the East favorite because of health and continuity
6. Boston is a dark horse for the ECF
7. Miami was a fluke in the bubble
8. The Knicks should be taken seriously

items.content:
The Basketball Buds: Dave Harper, Jay King, Tray Edwards and James Edwards. The rundown: Steph’s run has been incredible..."the NBA needs a best player award" said James, and what can they do if they get in the playoffs? Fred Fan Vleet's comments on the league prioritizing money over the game. The Celtics are back? Maybe, but they are playing better...why? Are the Wizards... good? And MaMarcus Aldridge retirement.

Fred Fan Vleet's comments on the league prioritizing money over the game. The Celtics are back? Maybe, but they are playing better...why? Are the Wizards... good? And MaMarcus Aldridge retirement.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Steph's Run, Money > The Game, Celtics Back? + Wizards good?

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention, Marcus Thompson and Ethan Strauss debate. Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: On Monday night the Nuggets lost Jamal Murray to a season ending ACL tear to his left knee. Murray suffered the noncontact injury during the Nuggets' 116-107 loss to the Golden State Warriors. A truly BRUTAL injury. 
Take 2: An Enormous Mistake! First it was Luka Doncic criticizing the NBA’s play-in tournament, now it’s Mark Cuban. In a series of messages sent to ESPN, the Mavs owner said this…
Take 3: Fellas, while you were away, Im not sure if you noticed, but James Wiseman was injured, and will be out indefinitely with a torn meniscus. As a result, questions immediately began to swirl on whether the Warriors should pack it in and tank the rest of the season.
Take 4: Continuing our weekly look at the NBA MVP race with BetMGM.com... and it’s still Nicola Jocic at the top at -160, followed by Joel Embiid at +225, then Damian Lillard +1000 and LeBron James +1200. Ethan if I gave you $1000 dollars, who would you bet on?
Take 5: Fellas, I’d like you to get out your crystal balls...who will win the Eastern Conference this year?

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Also some breaking news during the show, Warriors' James Wiseman out indefinitely with a torn meniscus. MVP talk.

items.content:
We are excited to announce The Athletic's new podcast series - Shattered: Hope, Heartbreak and the New York Knicks. Hosted by hip-hop legend Chuck D, the series dives deep on the past 20 years of the Knicks. Shattered reveals never-heard-before stories about the Knicks, team owner James Dolan and the NBA, with interviews from dozens of voices including franchise legend Patrick Ewing.
This is the first 5 minutes of episode one - a look at how the 90's Knicks team broke apart. To listen to the rest click this link or search Shattered wherever you get your podcasts. A new episode of Shattered will be released every Tuesday.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
In this edition of Point of Contention Jay King and James Edwards III debate. Hosted by Zach Harper.
Take 1: Fellas we are 50 games into the season, for most roughly 22 left until the playoffs and taking a look at the Western Conference, the Jazz, the Suns, Clippers and Nuggets are atop the Conference The injury riddled Lakers are 5th and falling fast!
Take 2: Last Saturday morning the NBA world woke up to what appeared to be an all night party with Paul Pierce, his friends playing poker, some “companions” if you know what I mean, and someone called Monica who, as Pierce himself said “could make some money.” Part of the festivities were broadcasted live for roughly 300 people on Instagram live.
Take 3: Clearly this has been a very mediocre season for Brad Stevens’ Celtics, and as noted in many a previous episode they don’t have a clear #1 guy, they don’t have a clear leader, they don’t have a signature style, yada yada yada.
Take 4: Continuing our weekly look at the Awards race with BetMGM.com... Last week we did Rookie of the Year, this week let’s do Defensive Player of the Year and it’s basically a two horse race right now.
Take 5: Blowouts. Earlier in the week guys “the Raptors uncorked the biggest blowout of NBA season in 130-77 destruction of Warriors” as one headline put it. At one point, the Raptors led by 61 points, the largest lead that any team has had this season.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Take 3: Clearly this has been a very mediocre season for Brad Stevens’ Celtics, and as noted in many a previous episode they don’t have a clear #1 guy, they don’t have a clear leader, they don’t have a signature style, yada yada yada.
Take 4: Continuing our weekly look at the Awards race with BetMGM.com... Last week we did Rookie of the Year, this week let’s do Defensive Player of the Year and it’s basically a two horse race right now.
Take 5: Blowouts. Earlier in the week guys “the Raptors uncorked the biggest blowout of NBA season in 130-77 destruction of Warriors” as one headline put it. At one point, the Raptors led by 61 points, the largest lead that any team has had this season.
 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers bring you another episode of the Saturday Slam and Jam. On today's show they discuss the NBA buyout market and if it really is a small market vs. big market issue. They dive into the top 5 buyout players of the last 10 years, and answer the question of if it is a small market problem.

Alex then asks the questions, "Are the Denver Nuggets title contenders?" With the addition of Aaron Gordon, does it put the Nuggets over the top? Are there different levels of contenders? We answer all that and more about the Nuggets.

Then Tony Jones of the Athletic joins to help us answer all our questions about the Utah Jazz, including if they can win the title this season. Then we play our game show, Andrew vs. the Beat where Alex quizzes and Andrew and Tony on questions about the Jazz.

Thanks for listening and tune in to see who the Wheel of Fandom picks next!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Alex then quizzes Andrew on the ages of players for Birthday Bash

items.title: NBA Trade Deadline Recap (Live)

items.content:
In this week's Point of Contention, Ethan Strauss and Marcus Thompson debate. Hosted by Zach Harper. 

Take 1: Last week Steph was getting upset, this week it’s Steve Kerr! Kerr lashed out at Warriors analyst Drew Shilling for allegedly misquoting Kerr after he appeared on a Ringer podcast in which he said he enjoyed last year more than the Final year of the dynasty which obviously included Kevin Durant.

Take 2: Just one week ago we were talking about the volatile MVP odds and yet again things have changed as two time reigning MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo moved into 4th place and is edging closer due to injuries to LeBron and Joel. 

Take 3: In yet another plot twist to the MVP race, James Harden is now showing the 5th best odds at +1000. And to boost his campaign, Charles Barkley appeared on ESPN Radio in which he said that James Harden may be the best player in the world today!

Take 4: Guys it’s Trade Deadline Day and players from across the league will be on the move to new destinations. Last week, we talked about which players we thought could be on the move and since then things have changed a bit.

Take 5: It’s late March and the Suns are 29-13, second in the Western Conference. That’s unbelievable. But even more unreal, is that the Lakers keep slipping, now down to 28-16 and 4th in the Western Conference.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Basketball Buds: Zach Harper, Dave DuFour, BIG Wos, Jay King and Tray Edwards. LeBron is out, and the guys are a little concerned over this injury more than prior ones. Then, the Rockets riding a 20 game losing streak, how will it affect their 2021 draft pick? Then Deadlines deals...can Victor Oladipo make a difference? Do the Hawks have to rethink the potential John Collins trade now that they are on a win streak? Ben Simons' war of words against Rudy Gobert and DPOY. Then LaMelo Ball is done for the year with a broken wrist, can he still win ROY?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Andrew Schlecht and Alex Speers are back again for another addition of the Saturday Slam and Jam! Today they discuss the week that was in the NBA, the Utah Jazz, Lamelo Ball’s emergence as a star, and the hope the Knicks are bringing to the table. 

Then at the 30 minute mark Will Guillory joins to discuss the Pelicans and Zion Williamson, how the team will be build in the future, the trade deadline and then we play Andrew vs. the Beat!

Tune in to see who is next on the Wheel of Fandom!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Julius Randle? And much more, join us!

The Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Jay King, Tray Edwards, Dave DuFour and Wos Lambre. John Wall speaks, and feels the Wizards handled his trade request the wrong way. Is he asking too much? Then Giannis calls the Jazz the best team in the West, which sparks a big debate on the Al Horford-Josh Smith Hawks between Jay and the fellas. Plus, Draymond Green calls the Nets the best team in the East, is that true? Finally the guys check on 'The Worry Meter' for the Celtics, Hawks and Heat.

items.content:
The Basketball Buds with Zach Harper, Dave DuFour, Wos Lambre, Jay King and Tray Edwards. This week...despite a loss to the Nuggets snapping an 11 game winning streak, the Jazz are really good. Is this the Jazz team people expecting last year? Are they the best matchup against the Lakers? Then the Nets, and the dynamics of who "controls" the offense. Who is the closer? Jeff Greene dunking on people, after all these years. After that the JJ Redick trade market, Can the Celtics get him? Do they need him? Knicks, 76ers perhaps? Then, Klay Thompson goes WWE on Rodney McGruder post-game.

items.content:
The Basketball Buds: Zach Harper, Jay King, Tray Edwards and James Edwards III talk about the Clippers now 13-4, and the playmaking of Paul George and Kawhi Leonard. Then the red-hot Jazz are rolling, 8 wins in a row. Also the Shaq vs Mitchell beef. What team has a better chance to level up? Then whether Kyrie is the issue after dropping two games to Cleveland. Are the Cavs coming together? Finally Steph passes Reggie, but didn't he really pass him a long time ago? And Kevin Porter Jr fresh start in Houston.

Then, NBA.com's annual GM Survey is out and the fellas react to some surprising results. Also why Jay can't stand social media when it comes to LaMelo Ball's passing highlights.

Sam Amick is joined by Anthony Slater and Tony Jones to discuss the NBA Western Conference:

Does James Harden finish the season as a Rocket? If not where is he going?

Who makes the biggest fall? (We can exclude OKC)

Where are the Mavs in the West standings?

How far will the Nuggets fall?

Will the Clippers drama keep them from the WCF again?

Who you got... Blazers or Jazz?

Are the Warriors a playoff lock?

Can CP3 get the Suns in the top 8?

Who makes the play in tournament?

Lakers or the field to win the West?


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: 10 Questions on the Western Conference

items.content:
Basketball Buds: Dave Dufour, BIG Wos, Tray Edwards, Rich Hofmann and Jay King go through this list of 10 questions to preview the Eastern Conference. 

1. Should Miami be the favorites to make the Finals?
2. Did the Bucks do enough to solve their problems?
3. Does Boston need another leap from Jayson Tatum? (Will they miss Hayward?)
4. Have we all abandoned Toronto too early?
5. Will Brooklyn have enough defense to compete for the 1 seed?
6. Now that Philly has a roster that makes some sense around Embiid and Simmons, what does success look like for this team? 
7. Who finishes higher in the standings: Pacers, Wizards, Hawks, or Magic?
8. Who is going to be the best rookie in the East?
9. Who gets the 1 seed?
10. Who makes the Finals?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Basketball Buds, Zach Harper, Tray Edwards, Jay King and Mo Dakhil. What is the NBA thinking? Going thru the Sham's report that the NBA may start the next season by Christmas. Then, Pat Riley speaks the case for the 2020 Finals asterisk, but why not let LeBron have his day? Victor Oladipo, the Pacers future and the Future (not a typo). Finally, the Nets new coach Amar'e Stoudemire and what is happening in Brooklyn? And...George Karl vs DeMarcus Cousins.

David Aldridge and Wos Lambre welcome in Lakers' assistant coach about what it was like winning the NBA Championship in the Orlando Bubble. LeBron's unmatched commitment to the game and how James is a lot like Kobe. Then growing up in Oakland, thick skin and being tough. Also JR Rider's status as maybe the best player ever to come from the Bay area. Finally, why Anthony Davis is a Unicorn and coaching young fellas.

items.content:
This week on Nerder with Dave DuFour, Mo Dakhil and Seth Partnow, the guys try to sort through the Lakers and Nuggets matchup, discuss the importance of chemistry, and a new installment of “Is this a thing?

Topics:
Lakers x Nuggets
Center matchup
Guards
Jokic/Murray pick and roll
Don’t let anyone but LeBron beat you
It takes more than talent to win
Clippers lack of chemistry
Doc doesn’t practice
Hard to put pieces together vs. adding a piece
Miami and Jimmy Butler, Spurs
Is this a thing?
Changing of the guard
Younger players in prominent roles (Tatum, Brown, Bam, Murray, Jokic)
All 4 coaches under the age of 50
Relying on veterans in the playoffs even when they are struggling

In this week's contentious Point of Contention Ethan Strauss, Marcus Thompson debate big issues in the NBA. Moderated by Zach Harper. 

Take 1: Everybody Loves Chris: Do people enjoy basketball or like seeing James Harden lose?
Take 2: NBA Finals BIG Board: Are the favorites favored anymore?
Take 3: Jimmy Buckets Blossoming in Miami: Did the 76ers trade the wrong guy?
Take 4: The Bubble Effect: How real is what we are watching?
Take 5: Who is the right Coach for the 76ers? Spurs? Nets? 

Produced by Jade Hoye

items.content:
David Aldridge and Wos Lambre welcome in 76ers reporter Rich Hofmann to dissect the unbelievable fall of the 76ers. From Joel Embiid, to Brett Brown and Ben Simmons, front office mess, and going all the way back to Sam Hinkie. 

Rundown:

0:00 Jacob Blake and Boycotting
9:00 Welcome Rich to talk 76ers
12:00 Finding answers / Ben Simmons / Lack of Playmakers / Fultz
19:30 Next Coach? Dave Joerger? Ty Lue? What does this team need?
24:30 Ben's reluctance to shoot the 3 / Embiid's health
27:00 Time to shake things up
28:30 Who is pulling the strings behind the scenes?
31:00 Elton Brand have any power?
33:00 Was the Process worth it?
37:00 Tobias Harris trade was strange
42:00 What happens now?
45:00 Can Embiid be a centerpiece of a championship team?
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Basketball Buds: Zach Harper, Dave DuFour, Tray Edward, Jay King and Rich Hofmann. 

Luka Doncic had a playoff performance to remember on Sunday...the crew is stunned. Flat out. Then Rich joins the show and is mystified by the issues plaguing the 76ers. What is Brett Brown's future? Paul George is a mess, and he can't stop talking about it. LeBron and the Lakers back on track? Finally, Fraud or Not a Fraud! 

Produced by Jade Hoye

Paul George is a mess, and he can't stop talking about it. LeBron and the Lakers back on track? Finally, Fraud or Not a Fraud! 

Produced by Jade Hoye
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Luka the Great, Lakers Fate, 76ers Future Bleak, Paul the Weak + Fraud Not A Fraud

items.content:
Nerder She Wrote: Dave, Seth and Mo. 

Eric Nehm on drop coverage. Playoff Trends Over reliance on drop coverage (pull up 3s over defense). Mixing coverages. (Is this a thing?)
Shotmaking 3-pt shooting and free throws are up. Over-corrections in the playoffs. The Bucks don’t adjust enough. Toronto is playoff ready on defense. Pop’s coaching tree and adjustments. Adjustments don’t matter if players don’t execute. 

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

ESPN's Amin Elhassan drops by to talk with Wos Lambre on the Clippers, Kawhi, rotations and perhaps having too much talent. Also Luka Doncic is the real deal, Jazz-Nuggets, Rudy vs Jokic, Celtics-76ers and finally why the Pelicans firing of Alvin Gentry was the wrong move. 

0:00 - Clippers, too much talent? How the pieces fit. Lou Williams. 
10:00 - Kawhi's playmaking / Best lineups
21:00 - Luka Doncic is for real
32:30 - Jazz-Nuggets
45:00 - Denver's Defense
48:30 - Alvin Gentry should not have been fired

Plus - which teams should be the most worried about their performance so far.

items.content:
Sam Amick hosts a 2 part special episode of the Tampering Podcast. In Part 1 Sam is joined by Nate Boyer, the former NFL player and Green Beret who influence Colin Kaepernick to kneel during the National Anthem. HIs stance on the NBA players kneeling, the story on he and Kaepernick, and morePart 2 with Marc and Alex Lasry, owners of the Milwaukee Bucks, begins at the 28:45 mark of the show. The Lasry's open up about being in the second level of the bubble, Giannis' leadership and play this season, feelings on Giannis re-signing, the chase for the NBA title and more.


      
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

The Houston Small Ball Experiment. Is it going to be successful in the playoffs? Will quality of play. 82 game players vs 16 game players. Clippers potential. Dark Horse Mavs.

Nerder She Wrote's Dave DuFour and Seth Partnow are joined by Dr. Maria Elena Bottazzi, the co-director of the Texas Children’s Center for Vaccine Development at Baylor College of Medicine, and Dr. Zachary Binney, a sports injury epidemiologist at Emory University, to discuss what we know (and don't know) about the coronavirus, how it relates to the decision to suspend professional sports league's around the world, and best everyday practices for handling the virus.
Thanks to @liminalphase of @AAAS for connecting us with world leading scientists like Dr. Bottazzi and a special thanks to @Sports2STEM for his assistance as well. 


      
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
The Baketball Buds: Charlotte Hornets big-man Cody Zeller drops in to talk about his project with Riley Hospital for Children wearing sneakers designed by pediatric patients. A great cause. Also D-Wade's retirement ceremony. Then Rich Hoffman on Ben Simmons' back injury and the 76ers' fading hopes. Finally Fred Katz on red-hot Bradley Beal, whether he stays in DC and the likelihood John Wall returns this season. 

https://twitter.com/RileyKids/status/1232120488090095616?s=20

items.content:
Nerder She Wrote's Dave DuFour, Mo Dakhil and Seth Partnow deliver one of the nerdiest basketball episodes of all-time.  First up: Dave and Seth are joined in Chicago by The Athletic's John Hollinger and NBC Sports' Dan Feldman to talk about the inner workings of player evaluations, draft combine secrets and more.  Then at (50:00) Dr. Nick Elam joins Dave, Seth and Mo to talk about eponymously named Elam Ending that was featured during the NBA All-Star game.

items.content:
The Basketball BUDS gather to talk about Kevin Love's antics and wanting out of Cleveland despite huge contract that will be hard to unload. Then where might Kyle Kuzma end up, and what other moves will the Lakers pursue. Kings talk! The NBA's idea to reseed playoff matchups is dead on arrival, and a problematic anti-load management article hits the internet. 

With Zach Harper, BIG Wos, Sam Amick, Dave DuFour and Fred Katz.

On a special episode of the show, we bring you a roundtable that was recorded with media members throwing their best questions out to some of the main principles from the new movie 'Uncut Gems'. Adam Sandler, Kevin Garnett and the film's directors, the Safdie Brothers, field the inquiries and discuss everything from KG playing in Boston, the state of the Knicks, the process of picking the right cast for this film and so much more.

Zach Harper, BIG Wos, Dave DuFour, Ethan Strauss, BLK Tray, Seth Partnow, Jay King, Derek Bodner, Mo Dakhil and Joe Vardon. 

Topics: 
Celtics / Brown-Tatum with Jay Dog
76ers / Simmons with Bodner
Food, NBA Draft, Lonzo with Ethan
Lakers-Clippers with Vardon

Produced by Jade Hoye

On a special sneaker week episode of the podcast Wosny Lambre brings you his interviews for preseason piece he did on Zion Williamson and his relationship with Jordan Brand. Wos got a chance to speak with hip-hop pioneer Bun B, legendary DJ and sneaker designer DJ Clark Kent and sneaker writer, author Russ Bengston about the top talent's kicks as the New Orleans Pelicans #1 pick is set to hit the court soon to make his NBA debut.

items.content:
The Baketball Buds: Zach Harper, BIG Wos and Dave DuFour welcome NBATV / TNT's Kristen Ledlow to talk about her new podcast, the Suns, interview etiquette and Gregg Popovich. Then Mo Dakhil drops in for a new feature "Foe or Fraud." Finally, Andrew Wiggins and the Wolves, John Collins and other player suspensions. 

Produced by Jade Hoye

Topics: 
Ledlow's new POD
Suns, Monty Williams...and his suits.
Coach wearing sweatsuits and what it leads to
Getting Pop'd
Sideline etiquette 
Antagonistic questions
Challenging Candace Parker
Fraud or Foe: Suns, Lakers, Celtics, Mavericks
Wiggins and Wolves
John Collins Suspended
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Basketball Buds: Zach Harper, BIG Wos, Ethan Strauss, Dave DuFour, Nitzan Bluvstein, Tom Haberstroh, Fred Katz, Marcus Thompson and Anthony Mayes
 Produced by: Jade Hoye
 Go to www.theathletic.com/dings for 40% off The Athletic
  
 Rundown: 
 Whiney Warriors?
 Curry taunting
 Do all good teams end up bit bitchy?
 Will this be an issue in the playoffs?
 Nuggets a threat to GS?
 Subjective calls rule the game
 It's not science
 The refs are human
 The last days of Oracle
 Westbrook's 20-20-20 tribute to Nipsy Hussle
 Shut up stat padding people
 The importance of Nipsy
 Welcome Mariano
 Steph's new eyes
 What is a PED?
 Betting odds for next Lakers coach
 Juwan Howard
 Talking Wizards with Fred Katz!
 Worst Ernie Grunfeld move?
 Porter and Wall deals 
 What's next? Where is the accountability? 
 Welcome Marcus Thompson
 Peanut Butter and Bananas
 Curry and Nipsey 
 Nipsey was different 
 Writing a book is death
 Marcus is a good dad, except when writing. 
 Steph needs glasses?
 The whiney Warriors
 Ref beef has unified the team
 Odds KD leaves for NY
 KD vs The Media 
 Monta vs marcus
 End

Tom Haberstroh, Zach Harper, Dave DuFour, Big Wos, Anthony Mayes
  
 Produced by: Rob Lopez
  
 Rundown:
  
 Eminem
 First Michael Jordan memory
 Wos vs Ted
 Dwyane Wade’s new hair
 Cookout vs In ‘N Out
 Fastfood Fries
 Lakers struggles mounting
 Is LeBron coasting or resting?
 Knocks on LeBron’s legacy
 Stephen Curry’s legacy
 Does KD need Steph or does Steph need KD?
 Lakers missing the playoffs
 Brandon Ingram’s progression
 Making bad comparisons
 Lakers plans falling apart
 Wos-isms
 Bad Intros, good shows?
 Pregame potty
 Russ vs Rubio
 Russ’ new role on OKC
 MVP discussions
 Boston’s issues
 Mad superstars
 Kawhi’s weather worries
 Ethan investigates Warriors ‘Phase 3’
 End

items.content:
Basketball Buds: BIG Wos, Tom Haberstroh, Dave DuFour, Ethan Strauss and Zaxh Harper. 
 Produced by: Jade Hoye
  
 Rundown: 
 Cardi B eating 
 Zach vs Magic fans
 Do we like players picking the ASG teams?
 Giannis to the Warriors!
 Making the ASG better b/c it's booooring. 
 500 Days of Summer digression 
 Manny Machado gets $300M what would LeBron in his prime get?
 How did the Knicks not pay LeBron under the table?
 ESPN story: Tim Donaghy conspired to fix NBA games
 ASG tidbits
 Kyrie and KD talking 
 Steph getting trapped
 Hated Harden
 Harden wishes he played in a more free flowing offense
 Dunk Contest
 Dog Talk
 Richard Attenborough's Dynasties 
 More on Donaghy
 Bacon
 Hunting and Meat Eating

items.content:
Basketball Buds: Zach Harper, Tom Haberstroh, Dave DuFour, BIG Wos and Ethan Strauss
 Produced by: Jade Hoye
 Sponsored by: http://getroman.com/b2b
 Rundown:
 Corey Brewer story time
 Ethan in witness protection?
 Fences mended
 Where does KD's frustration come from?
 Being compared to LeBron?
 Money flex?
 Shades of LeBron's "At the end of the day" rant
 The role of media
 It's not that complicated. KD is ducking the media. 
 Warriors are not confident he is returning. Why hide it!
 Ethan's book
 Warriors starting lineup not so good lately
 Defensive rebounding. Second chance points.
 Paul George for 3rd place in MVP
 Russ deserved MVP?
 This is not baseball
 Defining MVP
 Losing control and fumbling 
 Dirk in the 3-point contest
 Morey's PR MVP Harden machine
 "MVP-Ball"
 Tucker breaks Doncic throws ball to his ghost
 Lakers-Pelicans "War of Leaks"
 AD play or sit?
 Should Pelicans have made the trade?
 Magic Johnson 
 Rich Paul 
 Cold War between LeBron and NBA owners?
 End    Support us on www.patreon.com/countthedings
 Find us: www.countthedings.com
 Social: @back2backpod @countthedings
 Facebook: www.facebook.com/countthedings
